ci_support_linux_64_mpiimpipython3.10.__:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
impi_devel:
- 2021.16.0
mpi:
- impi
mpich:
- '4'
openmpi:
- '5'
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.description:
MPI for Python provides bindings of the Message Passing Interface (MPI)
standard for the Python programming language, allowing any Python program
to exploit multiple processors.

name: mpi4py

about.description:
MPI for Python provides bindings of the Message Passing Interface (MPI)
standard for the Python programming language, allowing any Python program
to exploit multiple processors.

MPI for Python provides bindings of the Message Passing Interface (MPI)
standard for the Python programming language, allowing any Python program
to exploit multiple processors.

raw_meta_yaml:
schema_version: 1

context:
  version: "4.1.1"
  mpi: ${{ mpi | default('mpich') }}
  build: 2
  # we use the broader ABI compat in mpi4py that allows versions built
  # with latest mpi to be used with earlier versions.
  # these versions of the mpis are the minimum versions we
  # allow and roughly match those in the CI testing for mpi4py.
  # we use the minimum versions on conda-forge in some cases.
  # see https://github.com/conda-forge/mpi4py-feedstock/pull/97#issuecomment-3575450098
  # and https://github.com/conda-forge/mpi4py-feedstock/pull/97#issuecomment-3574064151
  # for details.
  min_mpich: "3.4"
  min_openmpi: "4.1"
  min_impi: "2021.10"
  min_msmpi: "10.1.1"

package:
  name: mpi4py
  version: ${{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/mpi4py/mpi4py/releases/download/${{ version }}/mpi4py-${{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: eb2c8489bdbc47fdc6b26ca7576e927a11b070b6de196a443132766b3d0a2a22
  patches:
    - impi202116-win.patch

build:
  # build offset to be preferred over mpich 3 builds
  number: ${{ build + 100 }}
  script:
    - if: win
      then: del src\\mpi.pth
    - if: mpi == "impi" and not win
      then: export I_MPI_CC=$CC
    - if: not win
      then: export MPI4PY_BUILD_MPIABI=1
      else: set "MPI4PY_BUILD_MPIABI=1"
    - ${{ PYTHON }} -m pip install --no-deps --no-build-isolation . -vv

requirements:
  build:
    - ${{ compiler('c') }}
    - ${{ stdlib('c') }}
    - if: build_platform != target_platform
      then:
        - python
        - cython
        - cross-python_${{ target_platform }}
        - if: mpi == "openmpi"
          then: openmpi
  host:
    - python
    - pip
    - setuptools
    - python-build
    - cython
    - if: mpi == "impi"
      then: impi-devel
      else: ${{ mpi }}
  run:
    - python
    # we use the broader ABI compat in mpi4py that allows versions built
    # with latest mpi to be used with earlier versions.
    # thus we handle our own run exports and ignore those from the packages.
    - if: mpi == "mpich"
      then: mpich >=${{ min_mpich }}
    - if: mpi == "openmpi"
      then: openmpi >=${{ min_openmpi }}
    - if: mpi == "impi"
      then: impi_rt >=${{ min_impi }}
    - if: mpi == "msmpi"
      then: msmpi >=${{ min_msmpi }}
  ignore_run_exports:
    from_package:
      - if: mpi == "impi"
        then: impi-devel
        else: ${{ mpi }}
  run_exports:
    - ${{ pin_subpackage("mpi4py", upper_bound="x") }}

tests:
  - python:
      imports:
        - mpi4py
        - mpi4py.MPI
        - mpi4py.futures
        - mpi4py.util.dtlib
        - mpi4py.util.pkl5
        - mpi4py.util.pool
        - mpi4py.util.sync
  - script:
      content:
        - mpiexec -n 1 python -m mpi4py --version
        - mpiexec -n 1 python -m mpi4py --mpi-library
        - mpiexec -n 1 python -m mpi4py --mpi-std-version
        - mpiexec -n 1 python -m mpi4py --mpi-lib-version
        - mpiexec -n 2 python -m mpi4py.bench helloworld
        - mpiexec -n 2 python -m mpi4py.bench ringtest
        # Additional tests are in Python
        - python test_mpi4py.py
    files:
      recipe:
        - test_mpi4py.py
  # smoke tests for running against older versions of mpich/openmpi
  - script:
      content:
        - if: mpi == "openmpi"
          then: export OMPI_MCA_plm_rsh_agent=false
        - if: mpi == "openmpi"
          then: export OMPI_MCA_rmaps_base_oversubscribe=true
        - mpiexec -n 1 python -m mpi4py --version
        - mpiexec -n 1 python -m mpi4py --mpi-library
        - mpiexec -n 1 python -m mpi4py --mpi-std-version
        - mpiexec -n 1 python -m mpi4py --mpi-lib-version
        - mpiexec -n 2 python -m mpi4py.bench helloworld
        - mpiexec -n 2 python -m mpi4py.bench ringtest
        # Additional tests are in Python
        - python test_mpi4py.py
    files:
      recipe:
        - test_mpi4py.py
    requirements:
      run:
        - if: mpi == "mpich"
          then: mpich =${{ min_mpich }}
        - if: mpi == "openmpi"
          then: openmpi =${{ min_openmpi }}
        - if: mpi == "impi"
          then: impi_rt =${{ min_impi }}
        - if: mpi == "msmpi"
          then: msmpi =${{ min_msmpi }}

about:
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  license_file: LICENSE.rst
  summary: Python bindings for MPI
  description: |
    MPI for Python provides bindings of the Message Passing Interface (MPI)
    standard for the Python programming language, allowing any Python program
    to exploit multiple processors.
  homepage: https://mpi4py.github.io/
  repository: https://github.com/mpi4py/mpi4py
  documentation: https://mpi4py.readthedocs.org/

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - dalcinl
    - minrk
    - msarahan
    - ocefpaf
    - davidbrochart
    - SylvainCorlay
    - leofang

about.description:
MPI for Python provides bindings of the Message Passing Interface (MPI)
standard for the Python programming language, allowing any Python program
to exploit multiple processors.
